c. Landing page; Scores section in focus

title: 1st: Should the user skip login or has just entered their Favorite Team, then the user should be greeted with the Hide/Show Scores Screen
Once the user chooses to Hide/Show Scores, then the user should be brought the main landing screen
Landing: Verify Landing page displays once Favorite team is selected
custom_preconds:
IF App is installed and has not been previously launched
AND we launch the app for the first time
AND we are presented with the NHL.tv Welcome message 
AND we Press [A] button on controller to advance to next screen
custom_steps:
WHEN we are presented with the Select a Favorite Team
AND we select a favorite team
(navigate through the list of team; with focus on the team, we press (A) controller button)
custom_expected:
THEN we are taken to the Landing screen.
-*NHL.tv logo and app name will be in the upper left corner of screen 
-Game tiles for the current day's games will be displayed in a grid of 6 tiles (2 rows, 3 per row) 
-the current day's date aligned at top right edge of grid
(if there are more game tiles that can be displayed on screen, a VIEW ALL button in the 6th tile position lead users to a detail view where all games are displayed)
-Scores section will be in focus; with Video, Standings, Calendar, Settings available to the right
- Button hints (A) Select, (B) Exit, (Y) Change Date


* If located in Canada; Rogers logo displays in place of NHL.tv


(early design below, maybe slightly different in actual app)
![](index.php?/attachments/get/1581)

title: Deep-link Default Landing: Verify when NHL.tv is accessed via Deep-link the user lands on the Scores screen
custom_preconds:
IF NHL.TV app is installed
AND the XB/device and dev tools/Windows computer are connected on the same network
Instructions here: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/CDANDMSFT/Testing+Deep+Links
Deep Linking Test Tool
The most useful tool is the Deep Linking Test Tool which is installed as part of the SDK. It can be found %PROGRAMFILES(X86)Microsoft Xbox 360 SDK\bin\win32\ directory and the official documentation can be found here on GDNP. 
Using the tool is pretty straight forward. Fire it up, select your console, then set the Target Application appropriately. You don't need a submission build, or a Dash package to run this. If you just copy the Deploy folder over you can use that in the Deep Link Test Tool.
Launching a File
You can launch a default.xex that has been deployed to the dev kit by providing the appropriate path. Here are some easy steps to do this. 
Build your application and open up the output folder:
[Project Folder]/Xbox/Xbox/[Build type]
Rename the Deploy folder to something you'll be able to identify easily.
Copy your renamed Deploy folder to the dev kit's Game Development Volume (DEVKIT:)
Set the Target Application in the Deep Link Test Tool (located in Authoring and Submission folder of xbox360 SDK) to the file path of the default.xex you just deployed.
i.e. DEVKIT:\NHL-DeepLink-001\default.xex
Set the Metadata Payload with a valid deep linking value and send it off.
i.e. http://nhl.com/en-US/Calendar
custom_steps:
1. WHEN NHL.tv is accessed via deep link

Current Deep Link Values:

Calendar - Date Picker	http://nhl.com/en-US/Calendar
Standings - Wild Card	http://nhl.com/en-US/WildCardStandings
Standings - Division	http://nhl.com/en-US/DivisionStandings
Game Details	http://nhl.com/en-US/Game/[gamePk]
custom_expected: THEN the user will be brought to the corresponding deep link location without issue

option 2: (game) Page

title: ***Logout: Verify choosing Logout options successfully logs the user out of their account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the NHL.tv app
AND we have successfully logged in with an NHL.com account
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to the settings section
2. Select LOG OUT
3. Select "Unlink (nhl.com/Rogers) account" button
custom_expected:
THEN we will be successfully logged out of our (nhl.com or Rogers) account
AND the email/subscription fields will be updated to reflect no user is signed in
AND the button will update to say "I have an Account"  offering user a way to sign in again.

WHEN we return to the Settings page
Then the Logout button will update to say "Log In"
AND the logged out user's profile settings and entitlements will be cleared (and not be stored locally).

title: ***Logout:  Verify once logged out, previously accessible paid content can no longer be accessed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed the NHL.tv app
AND we have successfully logged in with an NHL.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN navigate to Settings
and we select Log Out
custom_expected:
THEN we will be logged out of the NHL.tv account
AND we will be unable to further access any paid NHL.com content that we could previously access

title: ***Logout: Verify after selecting Log Out, user is given a confirmation prompt
custom_preconds:
NHL.TV app is installed
User has logged in with a NHL account
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to the 'Settings'
2. Select 'Log Out'
custom_expected:
THEN we will be logged out 
AND the Account Management screen will indicate the user is no longer signed in 
AND will unlink their xbox live user account from subscription

title: ***Logout: Verify user's credentials are not maintained after logging out
custom_preconds:
NHL.TV app is installed
User has logged in with an NHL account
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to 'Settings'
2. Complete the 'Log Out' process
3. Navigate back to the login screen from Settings
custom_expected:
THEN our previously logged in credentials will not be populated in the Email/Password fields
AND we need to fill in our credentials again

title: ***Verify if the user's profile access rights update that these are reflected in the app's viewable content (invalid test case until recon services are stood up for NHL)
custom_preconds:
NHL.TV app is installed
User has logged in with an NHL account
custom_steps: 1. The accounts' access rights/profile are updated on the NHL.com website
custom_expected:
THEN the changes will be reflected in the application
AND the newly restricted content will be hidden/removed
OR the newly unrestricted content will now be available

REPEAT for both circumstances

title: ***Verify: Confirm that logging out as one user and logging in as another access rights behave accordingly (unrestricted to restricted)
custom_preconds:
NHL.TV app is installed
User has logged in with an NHL account
The account has premium entitlement
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to 'Settings'
2. Select 'Log Out'
3. Login with an account that DOES NOT HAVE premium entitlements
custom_expected:
THEN the new user will be unable to view the previously unrestricted content
AND the content will be restricted accordingly

The Enhanced upsell message will display instead of the Regular upsell message.

title: ***Verify: Confirm that logging out as one user and logging in as another access rights behave accordingly (restricted to unrestricted)
custom_preconds:
NHL.TV app is installed
User has logged in with an NHL account
the account is not Premium entitled
custom_steps:
1. Navigate to 'Settings'
2. Select 'Log Out'
3. Login with an account that has Premium entitlement
custom_expected:
THEN the new user will be able to view the previously restricted content
AND the content will have no access right issues

title: Verify: User receives an access gate if they have not logged in
custom_preconds:
The user has setup their system
Device is currently connected to an Internet connection
"NHL.tv" app is installed
the user has not previously accessed the channel
custom_steps:
1. Access the NHL.tv app
2. Select a game
custom_expected:
THEN the user will receive an access gate
AND we will be unable to continue without first logging in

title: Verify: User will NOT receive an access gate if they have previously logged in
custom_preconds:
The user has setup their Xbox One
The device is currently connected to an Internet connection
The "NHL.tv" app is installed
We have already logged into the NHL.tv with an account
custom_steps: 1. Access the NHL.tv from Xbox Home Screen
custom_expected:
THEN the access gate will not be encountered
AND the user will be brought NHL.tv Home screen

title: ***Play: Verify that linear playback can continue for up to at least 2 hours without issue

There is a LIVE game

2. Attempt to Play the event
3. Receive the Playback Option event

custom_expected:

AND the user will not be kicked out of the stream

title: ***Play archived game: User chooses "Beginning" from Playback Option Prompt

there is an archived game

2. Receive the feed select prompt
3. Select 'Beginning'

AND the location will be at the beginning
AND when the feed reaches the end the user will be returned to their original access point.

title: ***Play LIVE game: User chooses "Beginning" from Playback Option Prompt

We have accessed the app
AND there is a LIVE game
custom_steps:

2. Receive the feed select prompt
3. Select 'Beginning'

AND the location will be at the beginning
AND when the feed reaches the end the user will be returned to their original access point

Note: When started from beginning, the user may scan forward or select LIVE UI option to advance to the live point in the stream.

title: ***Play: User chooses "Resume" from Playback Option Prompt on a VOD game
custom_preconds:
[Case should be broken into VOD/Live variations]

We have installed NHL.TV 
We have accessed the app
there is a bookmarked VOD and Live games (a game that has been previously viewed and exited before reaching completion)
custom_steps:
1. Attempt to Play the VOD video
2. Receive the feed select prompt
3. Select 'Resume'
4. Repeat steps for Live game
custom_expected:
THEN the video playback will start
AND the location will be at the last location viewed when previously played for both VOD and Live games

title: ***Play: User chooses "Resume" from Playback Option Prompt on a LIVE game
XR-03: Verify app acknowledges change in User entitlement when switching XBlive accounts during playback
refs: MLB.TV CU10 - Final 1 - MLBX5CCF99D4-  Certification Fai
custom_steps:
1. Sign into an Xbox profile linked to a publisher account.
2. Ensure that the console is set as the users Home console and launch the title.
3. From the main menu, select any full game and proceed into media playback by selecting a HOME or AWAY feed.
4. Press the Xbox button to constrain the title.
5. Access the Xbox Home account picker and sign out of the Xbox profile mentioned in step [1].
6. Sign back into the Xbox profile mentioned in step [1] and resume the title.
7. From the Sign In screen, select Sign In > the Xbox profile in use.
custom_expected:
The title must allow the user to resume use of the title following a sign-in change.


Fail example:
The title remains on the Sign In screen.

title: ***Network: Verify bandwidth/stream quality adapts with network fluctuations [Let's rewrite and settle on reasonable bitrates]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed NHL.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we are currently connected using a wireless ad hoc network
AND we begin playing a video
custom_steps:
WHEN we throttle the network connectivity (using Terminal Commands for our Ad Hoc Network)

> EX:
> sudo ipfw add 1 pipe 1 src-port 80
> sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 3000KByte/s
> sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 500KByte/s
> sudo ipfw pipe 1 config bw 75KByte/s
> sudo ipfw delete 1



note: lowest bitrate stream coming from CDN is usually 800k - throttling anything lower will give network error.


or use network line conditioner
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the bitrate adapt
AND the video playback will adjust accordingly based on the connectivity of the wireless ad hoc network

title: ***Network: Verify video quality improves with connectivity improvement
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed NHL.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we are connected to an Ad Hoc network
AND the connectivity has been throttled to a lower byte setting
custom_steps:
WHEN we begin playback
AND we slowly increase the available connectivity speeds
custom_expected: THEN the video quality will improve to a higher bitrate as the connectivity improves

title: ***Network: Verify when throttling connection strength that bitrate playback adjusts without issue in both directions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed NHL.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we are currently connected using a wireless ad hoc network
AND we begin playing a video
custom_steps:
WHEN we throttle the network connectivity using Terminal Commands for our Ad Hoc Network to lower the connectivity speeds
AND we throttle the network connectivity to increase the connectivity speeds
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the quality of the video adjusts in both directions in correlation with the connectivity speed

Note:  XB1 has a cache of about 30 seconds of video, so if internet connection is downgraded, lost, restored, there is a 30 second delay between the update in status and the video playback reflecting the change.

title: Trickplay: Verify only Pause/Play and Back (exit video playback) during (pre-roll/mid-roll) ad is allowed
custom_preconds:
Recap/Highlight player and Archived content will make a call for ads if response returns a valid response, the pre-roll ad is inserted automatically...and if the VAST manifest includes midrolls they would be inserted also.

Currently only pre-roll ads are expected.
custom_steps:
When pre/mid-roll ad is playing:
 attempt to Scan fwd  or Skip forward though the ad
custom_expected:
The user cannot FF through an ad, but can pause and back-navigate.

If the user rewinds past or to an ad that has already played once, the ad is skipped.  (If the user then leaves the player page and returns, the ad will be shown again)

title: Verify pre-roll only plays once per video launch; once the ad completes, user cannot scan back to it
Verify transition from ad to video playback is smooth (i.e. no waiting)
MID: During a Live Feed, User is greeted with an advertisement during a commercial break (In QA, the Ad needs to be requested)
MID: Advertisements from MLBAM servers during commercial break should only last as long as the break itself
Verify Player Controls function as expected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed NHL.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
custom_steps:
1. Launch a video feed
2. Tap 'A' on the controller
3. In-player UI overlay appears
4. Attempt these displayed controls
custom_expected:
THEN the controls will function as displayed:
> A :Select
> d-pad controllerleft/right; nav l/r through UI
> controller LT/RT buttons; progressive fast scan back/fwd through timeline
> B : Exit Playback

custom_preconds:

We have accessed the app

custom_steps: 1. Open In-Player navigation UI and observe the CONTROL options
custom_expected:

AND when we select LIVE
THEN the video stream will update to the live point accordingly.

title: LINESCORE: Verify Linescore updates as game progresses
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed NHL.TV 
AND we have accessed the app
AND we launch a Live video feed
AND we tap A controller button to open In-Player Navigation UI
custom_steps: WHEN we view Linescore
custom_expected:
THEN the current game's linescore will display.

IF Hide Scores ON:
THEN Linescore is hidden
IF Hide Scores OFF:
THEN Linescores displays 3periods with linescore data updating in *realtime 


*MF data score data updates at end of inning.
